artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Yamaguchiya Tōbei
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 103; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 16–17 no. 16, p. 299.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; battle scene on a large mostly black boat; figures falling into the sea; man wearing blue and white loincloth climbing into boat at center; man in upper left standing on edge of boat next to a decapitated figure wearing a red shirt, with blood spurting up from his neck, and his severed head over PL shoulder of man with sword; clouds of black and grey smoke; ocean waves
dimension: 14 1/2 × 9 3/4 in. (36.83 × 24.77 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳桐 {Yoshikiri} | Censor seal: 子三改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
text: Dan Funaemon (C) and Satō Samanosuke Yoshiaki (L) 団舟右衛門, 佐藤左馬之介義明.
title: Picture of Masakiyo Conqering Korea
